title: 107_hr3459
content: The "TANF Recipients' Lifeline Act" repeals the 5-year limit on benefits for TANF recipients and provides an exception for qualified aliens from the 5-year ban on benefits. SEC. 3 amends the Personal Responsibility and Work Opportunity Reconciliation Act to exempt qualified aliens from the 5-year ban on benefits for the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families program. SEC. 4 mandates translation services for non-English speakers. The amendment requires states receiving grants under section 403 of the Social Security Act to use bilingual personnel and printed material in areas where a significant number of program recipients speak a language other than English. Failure to comply may result in penalties. If a state receiving grants under section 403 of the Social Security Act violates section 408(a)(12), the Secretary will reduce the grant for the following fiscal year by 2 percent. SEC. 5. INFLATION ADJUSTMENT OF BLOCK GRANT. The text chunk discusses amending the Social Security Act to extend the Block Grant from 2002 through 2005 and make adjustments for inflation. The text chunk proposes amending the Social Security Act to extend the Block Grant from 2002 through 2005 and make adjustments for inflation, including specific calculations for different fiscal years. The text chunk proposes adjusting the Block Grant for inflation by calculating the percentage difference in the Consumer Price Index for specific fiscal years. The amendments made by this Act will be effective on October 1, 2002.
